page.title: 03Glebe and Meredyke Farms.
page.content: Glebe Farm 183.906 acres and Meredyke Road Farm 113.448 acres form part of a farming complex of 997.217 acres. The whole acreage is farmed as one unit. The chief crops are dried peas and beans, wheat , spring and winter barley on a rotation principle. There are no animals. There are 5 permanent, 1 part time and 1 casual workers. The unit has 10 tractors, 2 combine harvesters, 3 corn drills, 5 ploughs 3 Rotaspikes,1 Rotadigger, 8 drags, 2 spreaders, 4 sets chisels, 1 ditcher 3x10tonne trailers, 5x3tonne trailers, 1 fork lift and 3 motor vehicles. The present value of the land is Â£3,000 to Â£3,500 per acre. Farm buldings comprise 2 driers of total capacity 1100 tonnes, 1 implement shed and 1 storage shed. Employees work a 40hr week for Â£103-16, they average 400hr overtime per year at Â£3-87 per hr.
